intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: What’s wrong, Ike? Done already? Come on, Son! You’ll never beat me with that attitude!

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ha ha ha! Think you’re as stubborn as your mule-headed father?

intro.speaker: Greil
intro.line: Ike. Grow up big and strong. I believe you’ve got the makings of a great warrior.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...Father. This isn’t a dream, is it? This... This is all real.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist. The sun’s going down, and it’s getting cold. Come on. Let’s go.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Oh...Oh, Ike...sniff...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: ...W-why...Why?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I was at his side, but...I couldn’t save him. I’m sorry.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: ...Sniff...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It’s... It’s so unreal...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Dad’s gone... He’s gone, Ike. Sniff...And...I...don’t...I don’t know what to do...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Don’t worry. I’m here.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Bro-Brother...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’ll lead the company...In Father’s stead...And I’ll protect you all. You, the princess...everyone. I’ll protect you. You’ll see.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Brother...Ike... No...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I won’t allow it... I can’t lose you. Don’t you see? If you go, then I’ll be all alone...I won’t allow it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m not going anywhere. I promise you, Mist...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Commander...Greil...Why is this happening? Why is any of this happening? Why now? First, Crimea...And now you...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Oh, Ike! Where’s Mist?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: She’s resting in her room. Rhys and Rolf are with her.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: That’s good...She needs to sleep. She’s been through too much. We all have...You should rest too, Ike.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’ll be all right. Grief won’t bring my father back to life.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I know I’ve been a burden on the both of you. Titania, Soren, I just need to thank you both for staying here with me.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Not at all...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: There’s no need. Don’t trouble yourself.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So...where is everyone?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike, to tell the truth...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: Boyd and I are back.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: How did it go?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: I can’t believe it! They just left, and they didn’t take one look back! Heartless scum! I’ll never forgive them!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Boyd? What’s going on?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Ike! Are you all right?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m fine. Tell me what’s happened. Start talking.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Well, uh, it’s...What I mean to say is...Uh...

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Shinon and Gatrie have left us.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Soren!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: What? There’s nothing to hide, is there?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: They left? Both of them? Why did they–Oh, I see. They left because of me, didn’t they?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike...

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: Titania told us you were going to be the new commander. Shinon just about exploded...He and Gatrie left not long ago.

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: We went after them. We tried to talk things out, but it was a waste of time.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: We all knew that Ike was going to inherit command of the company, didn’t we? It just happened sooner than we wanted. It was Greil’s decision. If some of us aren’t satisfied with that, there’s no reason we should stop them from leaving. As far as losing fighting strength is concerned, we can solve that by adding new members.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: How can you say that? After all the battles we’ve been through together, how can you say that?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Forgive me, Ike. I wasn’t able to stop any of this...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It’s not your fault, Titania. They did what they felt they had to do They didn’t want to lose their lives to an inexperienced commander.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike! Don’t talk about yourself like that.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m not saying that to gain anyone’s pity. It’s the truth. But even so, I have no intention of giving up command of this company.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Ike? Then what will you–

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’m going to follow my father’s wishes. I’m going to assume command. If everyone will accept me, that’s what I’d like to do.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Of course!

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: I’d already made up my mind. That’s what I was going to do all along.

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: What, so now you want me to start calling you Boss? Is that it? Well, I can do that. Boss it is!

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: I’m in, too.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Rhys!

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: Mist’s asleep. I know I missed most of the conversation, but I have a good idea of what you’ve been discussing. Commander Ike...Yes, it does have a nice ring to it.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What about you, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...Ike. I’m not sure what help I could be to you. What place is there for me in a mercenary company, anyway?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You are so weird...I’ve always depended on you, haven’t I? I need your tactical knowledge. I need your objectivity. You’re not going to leave me, are you, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Don’t worry. I’ll be here, watching over you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Thank you. I know I’m not as experienced as most of you. I’m going to make some mistakes, but I’ll try not to let you down.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Well, you’re going to have a lot to learn about being commander. I’m glad you’re serious, because it’s a lot of work.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Tell me everything.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: First, you’ll need to understand company expenditures. Then we’ll talk about ensuring that everyone is properly outfitted. And we can’t forget the need to gather good intelligence. Oh, and you’ll want to know everyone’s abilities and relationships.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Uh-huh...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Earlier, I spoke with a merchant caravan that’s taken refuge here in the castle. They fled Crimea at the same time we did. I told them who we are, and they asked if they could travel with us. I think they’re worried about protection from Daein. In exchange, they’ve offered us a good rate on items and weapons. They’ll also buy items and forge weapons for us.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Uh-huh...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: They also said we could use their wagons to store our goods. That’s one more worry off our minds.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Uh-huh...

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: So anyway–

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I know I said tell me everything, but...This is too much. I can’t keep up. Maybe I shouldn’t learn everything in one sitting. Can you show me the ropes along the way? Is that all right?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Oh...yes, of course. Sorry. I got a bit carried away.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I’ll take over for now. Why don’t you get some rest?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I’m all right...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You worry too much. Get some rest. That’s an order. I’ll do my best to manage.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes...Commander.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Good morning, Ike. How are things going? Does everything look good?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That’s not what I think, is it?

intro.speaker: Rhys
intro.line: If I’m not imagining things, that’s a squad of Daein soldiers. Why do they have to show up now?

intro.speaker: Boyd
intro.line: What gives? We’re inside Gallia’s borders, aren’t we? They must be out of their minds to pursue us this far!

intro.speaker: Oscar
intro.line: If they’ve come this far, I’m sure getting out of here alive was never one of their priorities.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: We’re in trouble. They have us completely surrounded. We cannot escape

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: So many of them...and so few of us...It doesn’t look good, does it

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Doesn’t matter. We have to fight. Greil Mercenaries, ready yourselves!

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I’ll begin formulating a strategy immediately.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Ike! Brother!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mist! I want you and Rolf to go in the back and hide!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: But, Ike...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Just do it now! Everything will be fine, but I need you to do this, all right?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Mm...All right. Be careful...

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: ...It’s happening again...My medallion’s glowing.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Mother...Father...If you can hear me, please watch over Ike. Please. Will you protect him?

battle.speaker: Soren
battle.line: Ike! The enemy has taken the castle!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: I’ve lost... I’ve lost Mist. Father, forgive me...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Huh? Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: I...I...I’m a traveling mage. My name is Ilyana. This castle...Oh...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Hey, are you all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: I’m sorry...This rain is so c-cold. I feel like I’m f-freezing...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: You don’t look too good. Are you sick? Do you need medicine?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: You’re awfully kind, aren’t you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: You know, you don’t look like any Daein soldier I’ve ever seen. Are you really one of them, or have they press-ganged you into service?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: I was traveling with some merchants, but we got separated. I came here to escape this rain, but some soldiers in black found me. They thought I was a Crimean refugee.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Oh?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: I tried to tell them who I was, but they wouldn’t believe me. They said they would put me to the sword if I didn’t help fight you. I’m...very sorry...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: Don’t apologize. You didn’t have any choice. If it had been me, I’d have done the same. But listen, I think I’ve seen the merchant convoy you were traveling with in the castle! There was a weapons vendor named Muston, and I think a woman named Aimee sold items...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: That’s them! Oh, that’s incredible! Are they all unharmed? Where are they?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: They’re fine, they’re fine! In fact, we’ve all come to an agreement, and they’re traveling with us now. I don’t see any reason we should go on fighting. If you’re with them, we can protect you from Daein.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: You’re right! Yes, would you please allow me to join your company, too?

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: That sounds fine, Ilyana. This is a dangerous place. Go ahead and seek safety within the castle. We’ll hold off the enemy troops.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: No...I’ll fight, too.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: But you’re sick...You’ll need some help.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: This isn’t the full force of Daein soldiers. More of them are waiting in the forest. You need me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ike
recruit-talk.line: ...Well, I wish you weren’t right, but it sounds like we will need your help.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ilyana
recruit-talk.line: I’m just glad to get away from those awful black-clad soldiers.

boss.speaker: Kamura
boss.line: What? They still resist? Impossible! Fight, dogs! ! Focus and press forward!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Haa...There are..still more of them...Haa...Everyone, fall back to the castle! Regroup! Regroup within the castle!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Haa...haa...Ah...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Blast! Not yet...Not yet...We will not fall!

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Brother!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist? You’re not supposed to be out here! I told you to stay–

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: I don’t care!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: There’s no way we can escape! This is it, isn’t it? We’re all going to die here, aren’t we?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Don’t be foolish! No matter what happens, I’m making sure you and Rolf get out of here alive! Once you’re out of danger, you go straight to the palace and stay with Princess Elincia.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: No! I’m not going anywhere. I’m staying here with everyone! I’m staying with you!

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: As long as I’m with you, I’m not afraid to die. We’ll see Mother and Father. We’ll all be together again. So, please...Stop telling me to leave you. I can’t. I can’t leave any of you again. All right?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right Don’t leave my side.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Thank you, Brother.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But one thing...you’re not going to see Mother just yet.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I’m going to protect you. I’m not going to let you die. I gave Father my word.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ike...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...Haa...haa...

end.speaker: Kamura
end.line: You took on the Daein army with meager numbers, and you’ve fought well. My compliments. However, it ends now. Prepare to die!

end.speaker: Daein Soldier
end.line: Aaah! Noooo!!!

end.speaker: Kamura
end.line: What was that? What happened?

end.speaker: Kamura
end.line: Cursed Gallian beasts...There are only two of them! How could they have brought my army to its knees!? How...How are they so strong?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is that why people fear the laguz?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: So, uh...Are you two from the palace? Did the king of Gallia send you?

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: He did. I am Mordecai, warrior of Gallia. Your hair is blue. You are Ike. Is this correct?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That’s right–I’m Ike. You saved us back there. Thank you.

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Ranulf told me Ike is not a bad stranger. Mordecai and Ike...We will become friends.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: You don’t know that. You don’t know if we can trust him. It’s too soon to tell. He’s a beorc. A human. You know all humans have two faces.

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Lethe!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Beorc? What’s that?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: That’s what you are.We with the power are laguz. You soft, hairless things with no power at all, you are called beorc.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Lethe! You are being bad. The king forbids this. We cannot fight with beorc!

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Most beorc call us by hated names, look at us with eyes filled with scorn. Sub-human? Hss! Is that how beorc treat their friends? Is that how beorc treat their allies?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You’re right...Some of us use that name far too readily. I guess if we had thought about it, we’d have realized it’s not a polite term, but we didn’t know you by any other name. I’m sorry.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: You knew no other name for us? Are we really so little to you, human? You, who forced us into slavery? How easily you forget. But we laguz! We remember. We remember how we have suffered at your hands. The king can say whatever he likes, I will not trust you. I warn you now...never speak to me in such a way!

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Lethe...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: What’s your point? Did you come all this way to complain to us? Ha ha...Typical sub-humans.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Scum! Those who use that name are enemies of Gallia!

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Grrr, grraa, sub-human...Enemy...He is enemy...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: You think you’re humans? The only thing human about you is your conceit You filthy, hairy sub-human!

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Graaaaoooooooow!

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Mordecai! Kill him!!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Ike!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ow...

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: I...Ike...

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: ...Ike, I’m sorry...I have hurt you...I did not intend to hurt you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mordecai, this injury is nothing. I’m fine.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: You’re nothing but a beast.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren! Stand down!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Why did you stop me? He hurt you! He could have killed you! We can’t let him get away–

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If you hadn’t provoked him, none of this would have happened. Right?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: But–I only... I’m sorry...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mordecai, Lethe, I apologize on behalf of my company. Please forgive Soren. It’s a poor excuse, but we recently lost...some companions. We’re tired, and we’re not thinking clearly.

end.speaker: Mordecai
end.line: Ike forgave Mordecai. So now I forgive Soren. No one need be angry.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: I apologize as well. My behavior has been unkind. I forgot our mission, and I have blundered terribly.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mission?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: The king wants to see you. We are here to guide you to the royal palace.
